title: Calories in Whipped Cream
meta_description: Learn calories in whipped cream per 100g, with detailed nutrition facts on fat, carbs, protein, and simple tweaks for lighter options.
assumptions: Sweetened heavy cream-based whipped topping, aerosol or homemade; includes sugar and stabilizers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, sweetness level, and preparation method. Check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100g of whipped cream provides about 300 kcal, primarily from fat and added sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a tablespoon of whipped cream?
faqs.a: About 25 kcal for 1 tablespoon (8g) of sweetened whipped cream.

faqs.q: Is whipped cream high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 28g total fat per 100g, with 18g saturated.

faqs.q: Calories in whipped cream vs. heavy cream?
faqs.a: Whipped cream is similar to heavy cream at ~300 kcal/100g but lighter in texture due to air.
Minimal, about 2g per 100g, mostly from the cream base.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in whipped cream?
faqs.a: Opt for light or unsweetened varieties, or make it at home with low-fat dairy.
